column4: I'm on Ubuntu 11.10, and there doesn't seem to be any way for me to change my dimness settings (on a laptop). What gives? The screen keeps dimming even when I'm on AC power....
I'm not using 11.10 so I'm not -certain- of this, but do you see a power icon in your upper righthand toolbar?
Okay, what happens when you right or left click it?

A menu comes up with the option to go to the Power Settings. I've been there. All I can change is 1) Suspend when inactive for, 2) When the lid is closed, and 3) When power is critically low. There are NO options for or extra tabs or anything that will let me decide what to do when the laptop is idle.
is there no checkbox for "dim display when idle"?
how odd. Sorry, if I had 11.10 I'd try to figure out what it was...
Hopefully someone else can help you...
it is odd. here's proof just so we both can get peace of mind ;) ----- http://images.cjb.net/c537a.png
right. the option is present in gnome on 11.04, so that's just another feature they've decided you don't need I suppose.
Problem solved. There's a box to tick/untick in your SCREEN settings regarding auto-dimming. Looks like they moved it in 11.10. Thank you for your help, though!
Ain't no thang, mang. Is there a reason why you didn't upgrade to 11.10? (are there benefits to keeping an older version- this is the first time I'm using Ubuntu longer than for 2 days)
not really going the direction I want it to. Since there's no reason for me to upgrade...
